segments.text: I see the woman drying the plate, her apron fluttering slightly as she moves.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It’s a system she’s got down to an art, but the overflow water is a glaring oversight.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Watching her focus so intently on that plate is both admirable and disconcerting.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy, meanwhile, is reaching dangerously far, almost defying gravity as he stretches for those cookies.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can hardly breathe, waiting for that moment when he’s going to slip and fall.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Doesn’t he know how precarious his position is? It seems so reckless.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: And the girl standing there, her palm outstretched, waiting eagerly—there’s something comical yet tragic about it.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The overflowing sink just adds to this chaotic scene; it’s as if everything is on the brink of collapse.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The sunlight filtering through the window doesn’t touch the chaos inside; it feels so misplaced.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wish someone would notice, but it seems everyone is lost in their own little world.
segments.speaker: PAR
